answers.answer: I'm confused.  Are you a diabetic?  I looked up Metformin to see what it is and it says it's for diabetes.  Maybe it's used for something else, too?Regarding insurance--I would call your husband's human resources person to ask some questions (pose them hypothetically).  Many insurance plans require a "qualifying event" to go on them if it's not during "open enrollment".  A qualifying event are things like marriage, adoption, change in employment of spouse (if your spouse loses insurance, they can go on yours), etc.  Also, there may be a preexisting condition clause that may exclude you from being covered for pregnancy if you go on it after you become pregnant.  There may also be a preexisting condition clause if you have a lapse in coverage (you'll need to present a certificate of credible coverage proving that you did not have a lapse).  Just some things to check into before assuming you can just get onto your husband's plan if you get pregnant.I would ask your doctor for guidance for you personally--especially if you're a diabetic and I'd also be very concerned about taking herbal supplements with prescription drugs (something else about which you should ask your doctor).
